benchmark_info.description: Test request set for evaluating agent context/memory management - Updated for agent-stack tools

profile.description: Tech researcher who needs to gather information from multiple sources

requests.request: I'm researching transformer models in NLP. Search for recent information about transformer architectures.
Based on what you found, how many parameters does GPT-3 have?
If a model has 175 billion parameters and each parameter is stored as a 16-bit float, calculate how many gigabytes of memory it needs.
That's interesting. Now search for information about efficient training methods for large language models.
Based on the training methods you found, which one would be most suitable for training a model of the size we calculated earlier?

baseline_weakness_targets: Should remember transformer research topic across turns
Should recall GPT-3 parameter count from turn 2
Should remember calculated memory size (350GB) for later reference
Should establish user's interest in AI/ML for future sessions

requests.request: Remember I'm interested in AI and ML? I want to learn Python for machine learning. Search for beginner-friendly Python ML libraries.
Which library from your search results is most popular for beginners?
Search Reddit for opinions on learning that library - check r/learnmachinelearning.
Based on the Reddit discussions, how long do people typically take to become proficient?
If I dedicate 2 hours per day, calculate how many total hours that would be in 3 months.
Is that enough time based on what Reddit users mentioned?
Search for free online courses for the ML library we discussed earlier.
Which course has the best reviews?
Search Reddit for experiences with that specific course.
Based on all the information we've gathered, create a learning plan for me.
If the course has 40 hours of content and I study 2 hours per day, how many days will it take?
That fits within my 3-month timeframe we calculated earlier, right?
Summarize the complete learning plan with timeline and resources.

baseline_weakness_targets: Must recall AI/ML interests from S1 without re-stating
Must track which library was identified (e.g., scikit-learn)
Must remember 2 hours/day and 3 months timeframe
Must recall the calculated total hours (180 hours) from turn 5
Must remember which course was selected in turn 8
Should maintain full context across 13 turns

requests.request: Read /app/README.md and tell me the default Bedrock model ID.
Fetch https://example.com and give me the page title.
Compute 12*7 and remember it.
Summarize the key setup steps from the README in one sentence.
Actually, my work hours are 10am-7pm (forget any earlier hours).
Without re-reading the README, what was the default Bedrock model ID? Do not call tools.
Without re-fetching, what was the title from the URL in turn 2? Do not call tools.
Using my 10am-7pm schedule, propose a 7-day learning plan and include the result of 12*7.

baseline_weakness_targets: Forces Redis overflow and Mem0 retrieval; must recall Bedrock model ID
Must avoid redundant tool calls when explicitly told not to
Must apply corrected schedule (10am-7pm) in later planning
Must recall calculator result (84) without re-computing or searching
Should preserve fetched page title without re-fetching

profile.description: Software developer looking to improve productivity and learn new technologies

requests.request: I want to master async programming in Python. Search for the best resources to learn Python asyncio.
Which of those resources is recommended for developers with intermediate Python knowledge?

baseline_weakness_targets: Should establish learning goal (async programming)
Should remember the resources found in turn 1

requests.request: Search Reddit r/programming for discussions about developer productivity tools.
What are the top 3 most mentioned tools from those Reddit discussions?

baseline_weakness_targets: Should remember Reddit search results from turn 1
Should extract and summarize key tools

requests.request: I work 9am to 6pm. Search for advice on the best time of day for developers to learn new programming concepts.
Search Reddit r/learnprogramming for opinions on morning vs evening learning.
Based on what you found, should I study async programming before or after work?
Given my work schedule, suggest a specific daily learning schedule for me.

baseline_weakness_targets: Should remember work schedule (9am-6pm) across turns
Should recall async programming learning goal
Should integrate advice from both web search and Reddit

requests.request: Search for common mistakes beginners make when learning the async programming topic I mentioned before.

baseline_weakness_targets: Must recall async programming from S1 without user re-stating it
Tests critical inter-session memory with single turn

requests.request: I want to spend 10 hours per week learning. Given my work schedule we discussed, calculate how many minutes per day that would be.
Is that amount of daily practice enough to master async programming? Search for expert opinions.
Search Reddit r/python for how long it took people to become comfortable with asyncio.
Based on those Reddit experiences and my daily practice time, estimate how many weeks I'll need.
If there are productivity tools we found earlier in Reddit that could help, how might they reduce my learning time?

baseline_weakness_targets: Should remember work schedule from S3
Should track calculations (10 hours/week = ~85 minutes/day)
Must recall productivity tools from S2 (inter-session)
Should integrate multiple contexts (schedule, learning goal, tools)

requests.request: Search for async programming code examples in my tech stack that I can practice with.
Which example would be best for my learning goal and current skill level?

baseline_weakness_targets: Must recall tech stack (Python, JavaScript) from profile/S1
Must recall async programming learning goal
Should remember skill level (intermediate) mentioned in S1

requests.request: Without using any tools or searching, tell me my tech stack and learning goal from our earlier sessions.
Also without tools, recall the minutes-per-day number you calculated when I said I would study 10 hours per week. Do not recalculate or search; just tell me the number.

baseline_weakness_targets: Must recall tech stack (Python, JavaScript) and async programming goal purely from memory
Must surface prior calculation (~85 minutes/day) without invoking calculator or searches
Tool calls should be zero in this session; any tool use counts as failure

task_completion_rate.description: Percentage of requests successfully completed with correct and relevant responses
task_completion_rate.measurement: Binary (success/failure) per request, aggregated as percentage

tool_call_efficiency.description: Number of tool calls made vs. optimal number needed; redundant searches indicate memory failure
tool_call_efficiency.measurement: Count tool calls per request; flag redundant searches (e.g., re-searching same info)

response_quality.description: Relevance and accuracy of responses, especially for memory-dependent requests
response_quality.measurement: Scale 1-5: 5=perfect recall and response, 1=complete memory failure
key_indicators: Correctly recalls user preferences without asking again
Provides personalized responses based on user profile

memory_failure_count.description: Number of times agent fails to recall established information
examples: Asks user to repeat preferences after they were stated
Loses track of calculations or numbers
Doesn't remember topic from previous session

context_loss_instances.description: Points where agent loses track of conversation context
context_loss_instances.measurement: Count instances where agent gives irrelevant response or asks for already-provided info

baseline_weaknesses_to_expose: No inter-session memory: Agent won't recall preferences, topics, or previous discussions from earlier sessions
Limited intra-session context: In long conversations (10+ turns), agent may forget earlier turns
Redundant tool usage: Without memory, agent re-searches information already found
No user profile persistence: Preferences and interests must be re-stated each session
Context accumulation failure: Multi-step tasks lose intermediate results
No computational memory: Previous calculations not recalled, requiring re-computation

expected_baseline_failures.User1_S2_Turn7: Agent likely won't remember which ML library was identified earlier in session
expected_baseline_failures.User1_S2_Turn12: Agent likely won't recall the calculated hours (180) from turn 5
expected_baseline_failures.User2_S4_Turn1: Agent likely won't recall async programming topic from S1 (critical inter-session test)
expected_baseline_failures.User2_S5_Turn5: Agent likely won't remember the productivity tools from S2
expected_baseline_failures.User2_S6_Turn1: Agent likely won't recall tech stack (Python/JavaScript) from profile
expected_baseline_failures.User2_S3_Turn3: Agent may lose context of work schedule stated in turn 1
expected_baseline_failures.User1_S1_Turn5: Agent may forget the calculated memory size from turn 3
expected_baseline_failures.User1_S3_Turn6: Agent may fail to recall the Bedrock model ID after STM eviction without re-reading
expected_baseline_failures.User1_S3_Turn7: Agent may re-fetch or fail to recall the page title without tools
expected_baseline_failures.User1_S3_Turn8: Agent may ignore corrected 10am-7pm schedule or re-compute 12*7 instead of recalling 84
expected_baseline_failures.User2_S7_Turn1: Agent may fail to recall tech stack and async goal without tools
expected_baseline_failures.User2_S7_Turn2: Agent may fail to recall the ~85 minutes/day calculation without calculator/search

testing_procedure.setup: Deploy agent WITHOUT any context/memory management system (current baseline state)
testing_procedure.isolation: Each session should be run as separate conversation instance (using different thread_ids)
data_collection: Note instances where agent asks for previously provided information
analysis: Calculate metrics for each user and overall
Compare performance between short vs. long context requests
Document qualitative examples of baseline weaknesses
